summary:
Adderall and Mydayis are brand names for a drug that combines four types of amphetamine. It's mainly used to treat ADHD and narcolepsy, but some people use it illegally for other reasons, like improving sports performance or getting high. 

Adderall works by boosting certain brain chemicals, like dopamine and norepinephrine, which can improve focus and energy. However, it can also have side effects like insomnia, loss of appetite, and even addiction if misused. In 2022, it was one of the most prescribed medications in the U.S.
title: Adderall
